# Ch'io t'ami

Ch’io t’ami, e t’ami più de la mia vita,
se tu nol sai, crudele,
chiedilo a queste selve,
che tel diranno, e tel diran con esse
le fere loro e i duri sterpi e i sassi
di questi alpestri monti,
ch’i’ ho sì spesse volte
inteneriti al suon de’ miei lamenti.
 That I love you, and love you more than my own life—
if you don’t know it, cruel one,
ask these forests,
which will tell it to you, and with them
their wild beasts and the hard stumps and the stones
of these harsh mountains,
which I have so many times
softened with the sound of my lamenting.
